extendedIngredients.name: cornstarch
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup cornstarch (or more potato starch if corn-free)

extendedIngredients.name: egg whites
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 large egg whites (or 3 whole eggs), at room temperature

extendedIngredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup light extra virgin olive oil (or oil)

extendedIngredients.aisle: Nut butters, Jams, and Honey;Health Foods
extendedIngredients.name: honey
low fat milk
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup non-fat instant dry milk (or use non-fat milk instead of water)
metaInformation: (or use non-fat milk instead of water)

extendedIngredients.name: oat flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups gluten-free oat flour (Bob's Red Mill, Cream Hill Estates, etc.)

extendedIngredients.name: xanthan gum
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 Tablespoon xanthan gum (use corn-free brand or guar gum, if needed)
metaInformation: (use corn-free brand or guar gum, if needed)

recipes.title: Gluten Free Oatnut 3 Seed Bread Machine
recipes.instructions: Remove pan from bread machine. Be sure the paddle is already attached.Add water, dry milk, oil, vinegar, eggs and honey to the bowl of your bread machine (while removed from the machine).In a separate bowl, whisk oat flour, potato starch, cornstarch, xanthan gum, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, yeast and salt. Add dry mixture to the wet ingredients.Snap the breadpan into the machine. Using the"Menu" button, chose option number 10. Press "Start".In the beginning of the mixing cycle, which begins about 8 minutes later, use a silicone or rubber spatula to scrape the flour from the sides of the pan.Once the mixing cycle ends, about 32 minutes into the process, push the mixing paddle down using the same spatula or remove it completely. Then smooth out the top.If using oats to top your bread, add them now and pat them into the bread using your fingers dipped in water.Once the baking cycle completes and you hear the buzzer, remove the pan from the machine, dump the bread onto a wire rack to cool completely, at least 2 hours.Once cooled, remove the paddle using a steak knife (if you've left it in) and slice using an electric slicer, electric knife, or serrated knife.While you can store the bread on the countertop overnight, it is always best to slice and freeze any gluten free bread.

steps.step: Remove pan from bread machine. Be sure the paddle is already attached.

Add water, dry milk, oil, vinegar, eggs and honey to the bowl of your bread machine (while removed from the machine).In a separate bowl, whisk oat flour, potato starch, cornstarch, xanthan gum, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, yeast and salt.

Add dry mixture to the wet ingredients.Snap the breadpan into the machine. Using the"Menu" button, chose option number 10. Press "Start".In the beginning of the mixing cycle, which begins about 8 minutes later, use a silicone or rubber spatula to scrape the flour from the sides of the pan.Once the mixing cycle ends, about 32 minutes into the process, push the mixing paddle down using the same spatula or remove it completely. Then smooth out the top.If using oats to top your bread, add them now and pat them into the bread using your fingers dipped in water.Once the baking cycle completes and you hear the buzzer, remove the pan from the machine, dump the bread onto a wire rack to cool completely, at least 2 hours.Once cooled, remove the paddle using a steak knife (if you've left it in) and slice using an electric slicer, electric knife, or serrated knife.While you can store the bread on the countertop overnight, it is always best to slice and freeze any gluten free bread.
